headline: Cajun Spice Mix
description: This Cajun spice mix has some heat and you can easily make it at home with common spices from your pantry. Add more red pepper if you like it hot.

video.description: This is a mildly hot Cajun spice mix you make yourself with common spices from your pantry. For those who like it hotter, add the optional crushed red pepper. Use this spice mix to make great Cajun hash browns in the oven!
video.name: DIY Cajun Seasoning

name: Cajun Spice Mix

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together paprika, salt, garlic powder, oregano, thyme, black pepper, onion powder, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a bowl until evenly blended.
Store spice mix in an airtight container.

review.reviewBody: Easy to make, I had everything already in the cabinet and it is very good. I made it exactly as listed, next time I will add a little more heat to it.
Love this recipe. Thanks for posting.

Great blend. I used half the salt and tried it on a grilled salmon fillet, and it was very good, far better than the store variety. I did add the red pepper flakes and found the heat level just spicy enough with lots of flavor.
A good, mild mix. Thanks for sharing.
No thyme! Used Italian seasoning and quadrupled the recipe!

I thought that this was a solid recipe. I'm wondering though if the people who claim that it was far too salty were using table salt instead of kosher salt. I started with half the salt and found it a little bland. So I actually added a teaspoon of MSG instead of salt. And that seemed just about perfect to me. I did not add the pepper flakes. I thought the heat level was good and did not need to be increased. One thing that I did find initially was that the thyme just felt like little sticks in my mouth so I put the whole thing in my spice grinder for 10 or 15 seconds. That seemed to take care of the thyme problem and mixed everything up very well.
Great recipe, lovely flavour. I just leave out the salt and it's perfect for us
This recipe is all heat and no flavor.

Thank you, thank you!! I fell in love with Cajun food while living in Louisiana. This recipe is spot on without killing you with spice. I made a cajun shrimp alfredo pasta and my picky child ate it all!!
Great taste, but next time I will use half the salt.
It was excellent used new spices, very spicy. This was second time I used this recipe. Will keep using. Thanks

This is a decent mix, but depending on the quality of those ingredients, the taste could be all over the place. If you have to go out and pick up a bunch of spices to make this work, you might as well just grab one that's already done. I really like Dede's Cajun Cuisine's southern spices. Pre-mixed, ready to go, so I can just get to cooking without the hassle of having to worry about if I have the right portion of spices to make it work. Check it out https://dedescajuncuisine.com/
italian seasoning instead of just oregano and thyme. also some hot paprika. triple recipe to have some ready for next time.
Amazing easy Cajun seasoning. I use it every week!! 10/10 recommend.
Great recipe! We don't like a lot of oregano, so I used 1 tsp basil and 1/4 tsp oregano. Gave my Jambalaya the zing it needed!

I am so grateful for this wonderful site and rarely write a review. This time, I felt compelled. I found this recipe to be far too salty! Though I do use salt regularly to season my food, this was so salty that I nearly had to throw it away. If you are a heavy salt user, I suspect you will not notice; but for the rest, I suggest you cut the salt by at least?? half.
Excellent spice mix, I need to make another batch, the first is history.
Followed the suggestion of cutting down on the salt, and it was perfect! Used it to season chicken and it worked great, will make a larger batch to store.
Great spice mix. Could always add more red pepper if you want it hotter.
I ran out of our favorite Cajun spice and was so happy to find this delicious recipe! I cut the salt in half, like others had recommended and left off the red pepper flakes and it was perfect!
Very good taste not to hot or spicy.
I made no changes to the recipe and will definitely make it again.
Wonderful on everything!!

I made this recipe as written, opting not to use the red pepper flakes and felt it had the right amount of heat. I wanted to try making the recipe "Instant Pot sausage, green beans, and potatoes" and it called for cajun spice mix, but I didn't have any. I'm grateful I found this because I had everything in my pantry. I will triple it next time and keep the mix handy for next time I make the IP sausage dish (google it) because it was fantastic, quick and easy!
Loved it, makes a ton of spice for future use! Soup mixes, jambalaya mix, etc
nicely balance smokey flavour
Need something to add a lemony or sour taste
this is my go to spice mix for tacos, quesadillas and fajitas . STOPPED BUYING TACO MIX FROM STORES
make it! I use it for many dishes!
Perfect balance of spice!
Doubled the cayenne and added 1 TSP red pepper flakes, and had to substitute for ground thyme (used half the volume as dried thyme). Used in jambalaya and it was excellent.
This has been a favorite of ours for years. I use it primarily as a rub for beef and pork. My only modification is that I don't use thyme.
Love it!
Easy to make, and tasty too! My chicken was delicious!
Pretty good
I added some heavy cream, which smoothed out the heat and taste.
Used this in a buffalo chicken cheese ball recipe in place of the brand name Cajun seasoning!! Excellent!!!
my whole family loved the shrimp and lobster Mac n cheese made with this spice!
Needed Cajun seasoning for a recipe. My grocery store had none. I happened to have all the spices for this recipe in my pantry. Whoo hoo! A real cost saver too.
I made it according to recipe in a large quantity. A staple in the pantry.
Very good. I used it to season my ceci croccante. My trick? Replace the salt with celery salt, leave out the pepper flakes.
Mixed this in with my ground beef to make the perfect burger!
Love it! Made a HUGE batch!
I added just a titch of brown sugar, I like the sweet/hot combo.
Just made a batch of this and used it in our fried chicken batter and omg it was perfect.

I live where these kinds of spice mixes are unavailable so I was glad to find this recipe. I made it just like it says and my creamy cajun chicken was delicious. The heat of it was just right for me (I don't like very much heat in my food) including the red pepper flakes. Salt was fine for me.
everything but salt...
Omitted thyme, because I didn't have it. It worked well in jambalaya.

this was beyond awesome. i didn't make any modifications which is rare for us. used almost the entire amount on a whole chicken that we grilled. the taste is amazing. we didn't feel it had too much salt but we tend to like salty, bold flavors. ty so much for the recipe. can't wait to try it on other foods.
A good basic spice mix that feels versatile. Definitely add the red pepper flakes! I didn't think it made it too hot at all and I think it needs that spicy kick.
Thankful for this recipe so I no longer have to buy the ready-made stuff. I'll reduce the amoint of cayenne next time to turn down the heat a little for my kids.
i did not chance it and I would make it again...
Made this and put it on chick peas and roasted them. Awesome for a healthy snack alternative.
Used approximately 1/2 teaspoon of salt and this stuff is great, Fairly spicy with cayenne and red pepper flakes, but that is the way I like it.

I made this on a whim. I'm not super Cajun-savvy. It was FANTASTIC! I added a bit of smoked hot paprika, and a bit of garlic powder. I used this mix with a bit of olive oil to sous vide some chicken breasts. My family gobbled it down in a flash! I will certainly make again! YUM!!!!

I have a whole jar that I made of this seasoning and I absolutely love it! I did add some store bought Tony's Creole seasoning and I also add more garlic powder as well simply because everyone I cook for loves garlic. I've always gotten compliments on the Cajun pasta I make with my seasoning too!
I love this recipe.

I omit the salt entirely. I'm trying to reduce salt in my diet and had to stop buying Cajun seasoning because it's so full of salt! With homemade, I can control my sodium and still enjoy the flavor! I use this in Red Beans and Rice, jambalaya, on popcorn and corn on the cob!

I love this recipe! Made it multiple times and right now I have a spicy version and a not-so-spicy version (for the kids) We went and bought really large empty spice containers so we an always have it on hand
Halfway through a recipe I discovered I did not have Cajun spice. This recipe saved my dish!
The cayenne stood out a little too much for me but it still helped hit the spot tonight with a cajun chicken pasta dish.
The only charges I made were less salt, 1 tsp. And I added garlic powder. I will never buy the prepackaged again. Easy and wonderful.
This is a great cajun spice mix!! I really like the flavor, the heat and the low amount of salt.

It was basic, so I added celery seed and dried minced onions to copy part of the holy trinity. I like to emphasize the flavors of what I am going to be making in the dry mix. IE, I include dried mustard in my bbq rub because I add mustard to my liquid bbq sauce. And I never add salt to my rubs. I have high blood pressure and carefully regulate my salt. Also, it is so flavorful that you only need a small amount to balance the flavors on your tongue.

I used the spice mix to flavour croutons. Added olive oil to the spice mix and tossed the bread in the infused oil. The croutons were very moorish. I will definitely use this mix for a lot of other recipes.
I cut the salt in half but kept the rest exactly the same and it was great on a pork tenderloin. The heat from the cayenne pepper was perfect and no other ingredient overpowered the mix. Awesome!

The seasoning was absolutely amazing! I covered my chicken in it and even mixed it into an alfredo sauce I made for dinner. However, I did add a little bit too much Cayenne because I was careless and moving too quickly so I might cut that back a little bit next time. We both like really spicy food, and it was a gradual build-up of heat but as we can ate dinner it got hotter and hotter, which is fine, but we weren't expecting it. But I will definitely be making this again!

This is my "go to" recipe for Cajun seasoning and it never fails. I used it in an Alfredo sauce to make Cajun chicken pasta using zucchini noodles and my family absolutely loved it!!!! This is a staple in my recipe book!!!
I've been looking for a good Cajun seasoning at the store. Could not find one. Tried this. We love it!! Restaurant quality.
No changes! I will make it against!
This Cajun Spice recipe worked out great!

Simple and delicious! I halved the salt because I like to use the spice mix in a jambalaya recipe that already has some salty sausage in it. As a rub alone, the full amount of salt would be fine. Great recipe!
This is awesome ! I've use it with chicken and fish. Thank you!
It works great on homefries!
This was a wonderful Cajun spice recipe to be used on anything. The heat was just right and I did add the optional red chili flakes.

I make this in big batches, jar it, and use it on everything. Cajun chicken pasta? Bomb. Cajun catfish? To die for. Sprinkled on top of cottage cheese? My favorite! It's so flavorful and made with stuff you probably have in your pantry already. Highly recommend!!!
This is a good Cajun spice blend. I didn't put quite as much thyme as it asked for. I put this in pork chops as part of a dry rub and they were great!
Full of aromaâ€™s and pack with bold intense flavor. Without hesitation, utilize this gem of a spice recipe for all your Cajun dishes.
We added 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes as I prefer only 'a little heat'. This made the 'Blackened Shrimp Stroganoff' dish fantastic!
My husband loves this. I always have to triple the recipie because that's how much he uses it. It's great with any meat. I love it best on sweet potato fries.

I'm glad that I cane across this recipe when I ran out of Cajun seasoning. I did follow the good advice of reviewers and added only 1 tsp of salt. I used this on a blackened tuna steak, and it was great. I will use this is many other dishes, as well. Thanks for the recipe!
Pretty good. Used it in some Red Rice and Beans I made up on the spot because tight on money this week. Added some good flavor with some chicken stock, canned tomatoes, beans, rice, ect.
Delish - if you have kids you may want 1/2 tsp less cayenne.
Made just as the recipe directed. Was delicious sprinkled liberally on pork chops before pan searing them. Looking forward to trying it as a popcorn seasoning.

Made it just the way it called for with two exceptions;
1) I used crushed garlic cloves, and
2) I used finely diced red onions.
Amazing results - love it - thank you
Needs a little more cayenne. Otherwise, it was good.
This recipe makes a good amount of cajun seasoning. It's not too spicy which is nice. I love making some and keeping it in the pantry to throw on chicken for a fast meal.
Nice blend. I replaced the salt with No Salt and used the blend to season lean ground turkey in place of Andouille sausage in Jambalaya. Really worked out well.
Made a mason jar full of it! Added a bit of super finely ground espresso beans just because I love that flavor in foods with heat, gives it some extra depth mmm making some jambalaya with it tonight.
This was good but not quite as hot or spicy as I prefer so the 2nd time I increased the cayenne and added cumin. That made it just right for me.

I cut the cayenne pepper a bit as well as the red pepper flakes and it was still a little spicy for us. Something seems to be missing for our tastes - perhaps a bit of chili powder (like in the brand of Cajun seasoning blend we purchase). We are very sensitive to salt and I cut that to about a half of a teaspoon. We'll see how this tastes on shrimp in a few days. Thanks for sharing a tasty recipe.
This is a very good cajun mix. But I do wish a bit spicier. I prefer more heat

AMAZING. I was making shrimp & sausage with summer vegetables in foil packets. The recipe called for Cajun spice mix. I did not want to buy pre made, and I tried this one. Simply fabulous. We all loved it. I'll use it again very soon on salmon.

The recipe I was making called for Cajun seasoning which I did it have and found this recipe. Excellent!! Just the right amount of heat but one can always add more cayenne to make it spicier. I made this with out using the red pepper flakes because children were eating the dish. Thank you for a great recipe.
Great Cajun spice. I omitted the salt for the health preferences of my husband. I add Himalayan pink salt to my personal dish when using this recipe.
Excellent flavoring . I cooked Salmon and used this seasoning and was very pleased. Thanks for sharing.
Made it without garlic due to a sensitivity, but it was still very good!
Daughter made it for me, added a dash "1/4 teaspoon" of brown sugar for an offset sweet and spicy! Little one sure can cook!!! Made Cajun burgers and noodle casserole. Thanks for the recipe!

Have used in my gumbo for years & keep on hand as a rub. Store bought varieties tend to add sugars or additives unnecessarily. We cut the salt for heart health and love that we can dial up or down the heat with the pepper flakes depending on what we're making and who we're making it for. Thanks for years of flavour!
